page.content: were industries dealing with the by-products of the smelting, i.e. arsenic and sulphur. Consequently arsenic works were set up in the area and continued manufacture until the 1st World War.. During the C19th the whole of Swansea's industry became devoted to metallurgical manufacture, with Swansea being recognised as 'the copper capital of the world'. The period during the warssaw the decline of these industries and the factories were left derelict and remained to scar the area. Unemployment became prevalent. In 1946 the Aluminium Wire & Cable Co. set up their factories to provide much-needed employment in the area.
